404.errorMessage: The URL you entered may be broken, or the page has been removed. <2>Go back to the home page</2>

dataDictionary.title: New Relic data dictionary
dataDictionary.intro: This data dictionary defines some of our default-reported data stored in NRDB and queryable via NRQL. This includes events like Transaction, MobileRequest, and BrowserInteraction, and our Metric, Log, and Span data types. These definitions are also available from our query builder UI by mousing over applicable data type and attribute names.
introNot: Data from our infrastructure integrations (for that, see docs for a specific integration)
Detailed integration-specific attributes for Metric data
dataDictionary.callout: This dictionary does not contain data reported by Infrastructure integrations. To learn about that data, see the <2>integration documentation</2>.

intro.p1: If you're new, follow these three steps to create an account and get going. (It's free!)
intro.p2: If you're catching up on the changes in New Relic One, start with this <2>transition guide</2>, or check out <4>what's new</4>.
intro.p3: Scroll on for more about our Telemetry Data Platform, Full-Stack Observability, and Applied Intelligence. Or, to get a wider view of our platform's capabilities, read the <2>Intro to New Relic</2>, and use our <5>solutions and best practices guides</5>.

t2.title: Start collecting data
t2.description: Our UI guides you through setup and install.

t3.title: Set up alerts
t3.description: Get notified quickly about changes in your system.

tdp.title: Data and APIs
tdp.description: Ingest, visualize, and alert on all your telemetry data in one place.

t1.title: Data explorer
t1.description: Query and build charts with NRQL, our PromQL-style syntax, or our visual chart builder.

t2.title: Dashboards
t2.description: Combine data from anywhere in our platform into customized dashboards.

t3.title: Log management
t3.description: Get logs alongside your telemetry data with our fast, scalable log management.

t4.title: APIs
t4.description: Find APIs to send data in, get data out, or manage the New Relic platform.

t5.title: Manage data
t5.description: Monitor and control your data usage.

t6.title: Build on New Relic One
t6.description: Learn how to build custom apps on our platform at developer.newrelic.com

fso.title: New Relic platform
fso.description: Analyze and troubleshoot problems easily across your entire software stack.

t1.title: APM
t1.description: Get real-time and trending data about your app's performance and stability.

t2.title: Browser
t2.description: Measure website performance, track errors, and see how users interact with your site.

t3.title: Distributed Tracing
t3.description: Track requests through your distributed system to find trends and anomalies.

t4.title: Infrastructure
t4.description: Monitor your infrastructureâ€”hosts, cloud providers, container services, backend services, orchestrators, and more.

t5.title: Logs in context
t5.description: Link your log data to APM agent data so you can pinpoint where things are going wrong.

t6.title: Mobile
t6.description: Understand user journeys in your Android and iOS apps and troubleshoot crashes.

t7.title: Serverless
t7.description: Monitor AWS Lambda, Azure Functions, and Google Cloud Functions.

t8.title: Synthetics
t8.description: Simulate user activity to detect outages and fix poor website performance.

t9.title: Workloads
t9.description: Group or monitor entities across your entire stack based on a team or a set of responsibilities.

ai.title: Alerts and Applied Intelligence (AI)
ai.description: Automatically detect anomalies, correlate issues, and reduce alert noise.

t1.title: Introduction to Alerts
t1.description: Get notified about important changes in your system based on any data you connect to New Relic.

t2.title: Introduction to Applied Intelligence
t2.description: Recognize issues sooner, resolve problems faster, and reduce noise for better incident management.

t3.title: Incident Intelligence
t3.description: Get an overview of all your incidents. See sources and related events, and find out how they all correlate.

t4.title: Incident Workflows
t4.description: Enrich your incidents with New Relic data before sending them to your notification platform.

t5.title: Proactive Detection
t5.description: Get notified by Slack or webhook of unusual app behavior.

integrations.title: New Relic integrations
integrations.description: <0>Integrations</0> connect the technologies in your stack to New Relic. Here are a few of our <4>370+ integrations</4>:

security.title: Security, privacy, and legal information
security.description: Find out how we ensure security, data privacy, and compliance, and find our terms of service.

t1.title: Data privacy
t1.description: New Relic takes your data privacy seriously. Our principles-based approach aims to go beyond the legal requirements for consent.

t2.title: Security compliance
t2.description: Whether your data is in transit to New Relic or at rest in our storage, strong encryption measures can help protect against unauthorized access or theft of valuable data.

t3.title: Security bulletins
t3.description: Security bulletins are a way for us to let you know about security vulnerabilities, remediation strategies, and applicable updates.

t4.title: Licenses
t4.description: All about New Relic's licenses, Usage Plan, and policies. Find out what open source software we use in our products.

defaultRelatedContent.title: For more help
defaultRelatedContent.intro: If you need more help, check out these support and learning resources:
defaultRelatedContent.list: <0>Browse the <2>Explorers Hub</2> to get help from the community and join in discussions.</0><1>Find <2>answers on our sites and learn how to use our support portal</2>.</1><2>Run <2>New Relic Diagnostics</2>, our troubleshooting tool for Linux, Windows, and macOS.</2><3>Review New Relic's <1>data security</1> and <4>licenses</4> documentation.</3>
